description: Dillon De Silva is on target as Sutton return to winning ways with a narrow victory over relegation-threatened Maidenhead at York Road.
title: Maidenhead United 0-1 Sutton United
title_page: Maidenhead United 0-1 Sutton United - BBC Sport
maintext:
Dillon De Silva was on target in the first half as Sutton returned to winning ways with a narrow 1-0 victory over relegation-threatened Maidenhead at York Road.
Sutton's Eduino Vaz sent a long-range effort past the post in the opening exchanges, while home midfielder Nathan Ferguson fired over at the other end.
Midway through the first half, Maidenhead defender Manny Onariase blocked a goal-bound shot to keep the scores level but Sutton's pressing paid off as Sri Lanka international De Silva put the visitors ahead on the half-hour mark with his first league goal for the club.
Tristan Abrahams thought had equalised for the hosts just after the break but his effort was ruled offside, while Miles Welch-Hayes cleared Lewis Simper's low effort off the line late on as Sutton attempted to double their lead.
